column4: whenever I try to SSH into my ubuntu box i get "Connection closed by <my IP address)"
have you examined the output of "ssh -vvv -l <user> <IP address>"
that verbose output should give you more information as to why it's closing the connection.
its strange though, I can SSH in locally but not with my DDNS
and im 99% sure i did the port forwarding right
what interface is sshd listening on?
id assume it is, it will work on the LAN
I'd examine your sshd_config, but beyond that I don't know.
where is that id assume /etc/ssh_config right?
what should i be looking for in here
this is where you need to consult "man sshd_config"
but id be shooting blind, i havent the faintest idea of what im looking for here
I can't help you if you're not willing to read the manual.
